questions.label: Social Communication & Interaction
questions.name: consent
options: I confirm that the information I am about to provide regarding my child's health is correct to the best of my knowledge. I authorize the Jiveesha team to use this information to plan the treatment needed to restore my child's health.

questions.label: Child's Name
questions.name: childName

questions.label: Child's Date of Birth
questions.name: childDob

questions.label: Gender
questions.name: gender

questions.label: Does your child understand and use appropriate eye contact during conversations or social interactions? (Atypical: Rarely/Never)
questions.name: eyeContact

questions.label: Does your child easily engage in back-and-forth conversations, showing interest in what others say and responding appropriately? (Atypical: Rarely/Never)
questions.name: backForthConversations

questions.label: Does your child understand and use nonverbal cues, such as facial expressions, body language, and gestures, to communicate effectively? (Atypical: Rarely/Never)
questions.name: nonverbalCues

questions.label: Does your child initiate and maintain friendships with peers, showing an understanding of social rules and expectations? (Atypical: Rarely/Never)
questions.name: friendshipSkills

questions.label: Does your child adjust their communication style and behavior to suit different social contexts (e.g., speaking differently to an adult vs. a friend, behaving differently in a classroom vs. a playground)? (Atypical: Rarely/Never)
questions.name: communicationStyleAdjustment

questions.label: Does your child understand and respond to humor, sarcasm, or figurative language (e.g., idioms, metaphors)? (Atypical: Rarely/Never)
questions.name: humorSarcasmUnderstanding

questions.label: Does your child show empathy or concern for others' feelings? (Atypical: Rarely/Never)
questions.name: empathyConcern

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty understanding social situations or the perspectives of others? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: socialSituationsUnderstanding

questions.label: Does your child prefer solitary activities over group play or social interaction? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: solitaryPreference

questions.label: Does your child struggle with turn-taking in conversations or games? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: turnTakingStruggles

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty resolving conflicts with peers? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: conflictResolutionDifficulty

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty understanding unwritten social rules or expectations? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: unwrittenSocialRules

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty shifting attention from one task to another, especially when interrupted? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: attentionShiftingDifficulty

questions.label: Does your child struggle with planning and organizing schoolwork or daily activities? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: planningOrganizingStruggles

questions.label: Does your child have trouble remembering and following multi-step instructions without reminders? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: multiStepInstructionsTrouble

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty managing their time effectively for homework or chores? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: timeManagementDifficulty

questions.label: Does your child struggle to adapt to changes in routine or unexpected events, becoming upset or rigid? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: adaptationToChangesStruggle

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty controlling impulsive actions or words? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: impulseControlDifficulty

questions.label: Does your child often lose or misplace belongings needed for school or activities? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: losingMisplacingBelongings

questions.label: Does your child have trouble initiating tasks or activities, even when they know what to do? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: taskInitiationTrouble

questions.label: Does your child struggle with problem-solving, especially when a solution isn't immediately obvious? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: problemSolvingStruggles

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty monitoring their own behavior and making corrections? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: selfMonitoringDifficulty

questions.label: Does your child have trouble staying focused on tasks that are not highly engaging to them? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: stayingFocusedNonEngaging

questions.label: Does your child frequently forget instructions or what they were supposed to do? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: forgettingInstructions

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty managing their emotions, leading to frequent outbursts, meltdowns, or excessive frustration? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: emotionalManagementDifficulty

questions.label: Does your child struggle to express their feelings or needs verbally in a clear and appropriate manner? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: expressingFeelingsVerbally

questions.label: Does your child use repetitive or unusual phrases, or echo words/sentences spoken by others (echolalia)? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: repetitiveUnusualPhrases

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty understanding complex verbal instructions or questions? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: complexVerbalInstructions

questions.label: Does your child have a limited range of emotional expression or seem to have difficulty understanding the emotions of others? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: limitedEmotionalExpression

questions.label: Does your child struggle to initiate or maintain conversations with peers or adults? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: conversationInitiationMaintenance

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty understanding abstract language, jokes, or sarcasm? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: abstractLanguageDifficulty

questions.label: Does your child speak in an unusually flat, robotic, or overly formal tone? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: flatFormalTone

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty telling a story or recounting events in a logical sequence? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: storytellingDifficulty

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty understanding social nuances in communication (e.g., knowing when it's their turn to speak, understanding implied meanings)? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: socialNuancesUnderstanding

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty expressing their needs or wants clearly and directly? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: expressingNeedsWants

questions.label: Does your child often misunderstand social cues or intentions of others due to language difficulties? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: misunderstandSocialCues

questions.label: Does your child have unusually intense or focused interests in specific topics or objects that are not typical for their age? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: intenseInterests

questions.label: Does your child engage in repetitive body movements (e.g., hand flapping, rocking, spinning) or manipulate objects in a repetitive way (e.g., lining up toys, spinning wheels)? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: repetitiveMovements

questions.label: Does your child insist on strict adherence to routines and become very distressed by minor changes? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: routineAdherence

questions.label: Does your child have unusual or extreme reactions to sensory input (e.g., strong aversion to certain sounds/textures, excessive smelling/touching of objects, fascination with lights/movement)? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: sensoryReactions

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty engaging in imaginative or varied play, preferring to repeat the same play patterns? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: imaginativePlayDifficulty

questions.label: Does your child show an unusual attachment to specific inanimate objects? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: attachmentToObjects

questions.label: Does your child have ritualistic behaviors that they must perform in a specific order or way, and become upset if interrupted? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: ritualisticBehaviors

questions.label: Does your child talk excessively about a narrow range of topics, often without regard for the listener's interest? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: narrowTopicTalk

questions.label: Does your child show unusual resistance to learning new skills or trying new activities, preferring familiar ones? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: resistanceToNewSkills

questions.label: Does your child have a strong need for predictability and become anxious or upset when plans change? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: needForPredictability

questions.label: Does your child engage in self-stimulatory behaviors (stimming) when excited, anxious, or overwhelmed? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: selfStimulatoryBehaviors

questions.label: Does your child have difficulty transitioning between activities or environments? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: transitionDifficulty

questions.label: Does your child often fail to give close attention to details or make careless mistakes in schoolwork or other activities? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: attentionToDetails

questions.label: Does your child often have trouble holding attention on tasks or play activities? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: holdingAttention

questions.label: Does your child often not seem to listen when spoken to directly? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: notListening

questions.label: Does your child often not follow through on instructions and fail to finish schoolwork, chores, or duties? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: notFollowingInstructions

questions.label: Does your child often have trouble organizing tasks and activities? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: organizingTasks

questions.label: Does your child often avoid, dislike, or is reluctant to do tasks that require mental effort over a long period of time (e.g., homework)? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: avoidingMentalEffort

questions.label: Does your child often lose things necessary for tasks or activities (e.g., school materials, pencils, books)? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: losingThings

questions.label: Is your child often easily distracted by unrelated stimuli? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: easilyDistracted

questions.label: Is your child often forgetful in daily activities? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: forgetfulDailyActivities

questions.label: Does your child often fidget with or tap hands or feet, or squirm in their seat? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: fidgetingSquirming

questions.label: Does your child often leave their seat in situations when remaining seated is expected (e.g., in the classroom)? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: leavingSeat

questions.label: Does your child often run about or climb in situations where it is not appropriate? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: runningClimbing

questions.label: Is your child often unable to play or take part in leisure activities quietly? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: quietLeisureActivities

questions.label: Is your child often "on the go" acting as if "driven by a motor"? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: drivenByMotor

questions.label: Does your child often talk excessively? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: talkingExcessively

questions.label: Does your child often blurt out an answer before a question has been completed? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: blurtingAnswers

questions.label: Does your child often have trouble waiting their turn? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: waitingTurn

questions.label: Does your child often interrupt or intrude on others (e.g., butts into conversations or games)? (Atypical: Often)
questions.name: interruptingOthers
